title: How to Complete an I9 Form

steps.title: Put your full legal name on the form.
steps.content: Put your full legal name on the form. Include both names if you have 2 first names or 2 last names. You only need to use your middle initial, not your full middle name. You'll also need to add any other last names you've had, such as your maiden name, if you have one. [1] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source If you happen to only have 1 name, place it in the last name field and "unknown" in the first name field. Add the hyphen if your name is hyphenated.

steps.title: Add your address and birth date.
steps.content: Add your address and birth date. You'll need to fill in your address, including an apartment number if you have one. Add your date of birth, as well, using the month, day, and year. [2] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Provide information on your legal status.
steps.content: Provide information on your legal status. Check the box that applies. Your choices are U.S citizen, noncitizen national, lawful permanent resident, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. If applicable, you'll also need to provide your Alien Number/USCIS number, foreign passport number with the country, or a Form I-94 admission number, as well as when your work permit expires. [3] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source You need either an Alien Number/USCIS or a Form I-94 admission number, not both. Your Alien Number is much like a Social Security number, as it is a unique number assigned to you, though it can have anywhere from 7 to 9 digits. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add optional information.
steps.content: Add optional information. You'll also add your Social Security number and email if your employer wants to use E-Verify. There's a place for your phone number, too, if you want to include it as a way to be contacted. [5] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source E-Verify is a way to verify electronically that you are legally allowed to work in the U.S.

steps.title: Sign and date the form.
steps.content: Sign and date the form. Once you've completed the form to the best of your knowledge, you'll need to provide a signature and date. However, you can sign it electronically. [6] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source Usually, your employer will set up your electronic signature. You'll use software provided by the company to create a signature and date, and you'll agree that you read the form. Another option is printing the form, signing it, and then scanning it to create an electronic copy.

steps.title: Complete the I-9 on the first day of work.
steps.content: Complete the I-9 on the first day of work. As the employee, it's your job to fill this out before or on the first day you work. This timeline is mandated by the government. [7] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Present your documentation to the employer.
steps.content: Present your documentation to the employer. After you've completed the form, you must present documents to show you're able to work legally in the U.S. Your employer will then examine them and finish the form. [8] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source You can present 1 item from List A, or a combination of 2 items from List B and List C. List A includes the following: U.S. Passport or Passport Card Permanent Resident or Alien Registration Receipt Card Employment Authorization Document Card A foreign passport with a Form 1-94 or a I-551 stamp/Form I-551 A passport from the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM) or the Republic of the Marshall Islands (RMI) with Form I-94 or Form I-94A [9] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Present 2 documents from List B and List C.
steps.content: Present 2 documents from List B and List C. If you don't have a document from List A, present 1 each from List B and List C. You can use the following documents: [10] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source List B includes the following: A driver's license A government-issued photo ID card with basic biographical information A hospital, school, or doctor record, if you're under 18 with no other ID [11] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source List C includes the following: An unrestricted Social Security card Consular Report of Birth Abroad (Form FS-240) Certification of Birth Abroad issued by the U.S. Department of State (Form FS-545) Certification of Report of Birth issued by the U.S. Department of State (Form DS-1350) An original birth certificate A Native American tribal document A U.S. Citizen ID Card (Form I-197) An Identification Card for Use of Resident Citizen in the United States (Form I-179) An authorization document issued by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) [12] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Check the first section.
steps.content: Check the first section. Before filling in the employer section, make sure the first section is completely filled in by the employee. Also, ensure the employee signed and dated it. [13] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source Keep in mind that only the employer should fill out this section, not the employee.

steps.title: Examine the documentation.
steps.content: Examine the documentation. The employee must present their documentation to you upon completion of the form. It's your job to examine the documents and ensure they look valid, as well as make sure they meet the requirements of 1 document from List A or a document each from List B and List C. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Fill in the employee's information.
steps.content: Fill in the employee's information. You'll need to fill in the employee's name in the second section, as well as their employment status. Fill in the information for each document, including the document number, the issuing authority, document title, and expiration date (if needed). [15] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Add the date the employee began.
steps.content: Add the date the employee began. You'll need to add the date your employee began working for the company. It can be a date in the future if the employee hasn't started yet. [16] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Enter your information and the company's information.
steps.content: Enter your information and the company's information. Add your full name and title. Put in the company's name and most appropriate company address in regards to the employee. Sign and date the form. [17] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Give the documentation back to the employee.
steps.content: Give the documentation back to the employee. Once you've verified that the documentation is correct, return it to the employee. You should hold on to the documentation only as long as necessary. [18] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Complete the third section and the employee's name.
steps.content: Complete the third section and the employee's name. If you rehire an employee within 3 years of them leaving or your employee changes their name, you can complete section 3 only for reverification. The only exception is you must fill in the employee's name in the employer section. [19] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source

steps.title: Re-verify when an employee's documentation expires.
steps.content: Re-verify when an employee's documentation expires. When you fill in the form the first time, note when the employee's documentation expires. You'll need to re-verify it when it does. You won't need to do this for U.S. Citizens or noncitizen nationals. [20] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source Request the same documentation as before. Examine it. If it checks out, record the document's information, and then sign and date the form.

steps.title: Examine the original I-9 for rehires.
steps.content: Examine the original I-9 for rehires. Check to see if the documentation has expired. If it hasn't, simply enter the new date of employment. If it has, examine either a List A OR List C documentation. You don't need to look at the List B documentation. [21] X Trustworthy Source US Citizenship and Immigration Services U.S. government agency in charge of the naturalization and immigration systems Go to source Enter the documentation information if you examined them. Sign and date the form.
